cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Lower Florida Keys early Sunday, then turning north-northwest and tracking up the Florida peninsula along or just inland of the west coast before moving into southwest Georgia Monday afternoon

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Fernandina Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to Indian Pass, including the Florida Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida coastline (Atlantic and Gulf) and southeast Georgia, including Jacksonville’s Atlantic coast and lower St. Johns River
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with occasional hurricane-force gusts possible Monday as the center passes west of Jacksonville.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the Atlantic beaches and within the lower St. Johns River near Jacksonville during high tide Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–15 inches of rain with isolated higher totals, leading to flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
